resource.chars:
about an hour & quarter after the first of his being 
bit a chafing-dish of glowing Char-coal was brought 
in, & his arm, ye cloaths being stript off of it, was 
held over it as near as he could bear it, while his 
wife rubb’d in with her hand the <s>medicine with her hand <u>wch <\u> I had prepared & kept myself *<\s> sallad-oil, turn-
ing his arm continually round as if she would have 
roasted it over the coals; he said yt the pain soon a-
bated, but ye swelling did not diminish much, & most 
violent vomitings & purgings soon ensued, & his pulse 
became so low & so often interrupted, <s>that he was 
thought in very great danger of his life, so that 
our Honourable President & the other physicians pre-
sent <\s> it was thought proper by ye physicians present to give him the following 
cordial Draughts at about 1/4 of an hours distance 
between each.
1. Rx. As. Lact. paeon. comp. aa. Zziij. Sp. Laven-
dulae Zi:m Pro duobus Haustibus.
2. Rx. Confect. Raleigh. Zss. Aq. Theriacal. Zziss.
Sp. C. C. qtt.x.m.f. Haustus.
3. Rx. Confect. Raleigh Theriac. Andromach. aa.
Zss. Sal. C.C. 
gr.r. Aq. theriacal Zzij. pro duobus 
haustibus.
He said he was not sensible of any great Releif 
from these cordials, but yt a Glass or two of <s>his 
own Remedy <\s> olive oil drank down seemed to give him some 

* <u>wch <\u> I had procured & kept 
myself in my pocket, least they should privately add any thing to it.
I bought it <s>for<\s> by ye name of Lucca Oil.
